name: Mixed Bag 2 Quiz | Mixed 10 Q. Tough [A] | 10 Questions

questions.text: In what century was 'Robinson Crusoe' written?
Who was the flying horse in Greek legend?
questions.explanation:
Pegasus.

	Son of Poseidon, God of the sea.

questions.text: What modern instrument do virginals and the celesta resemble?
questions.explanation:
Piano.

	The virginal is a harpsichord and the celesta is an offshoot of the glockenspiel.

questions.text: In what country were the Mau-Mau active?
questions.explanation:
Kenya.

	They were a secret Kikuyu society.

questions.text: Of the following what color of visible light has the lowest energy?
What bird was the symbol of the Romans?
questions.explanation:
Eagle.

	It was the symbol of certain Roman legions of France, under the Bonapartes, and of Germany.

Shirt.

	It came to being when the tunic was narrowed and shortened.

questions.text: How many centuries are there in a legion?
questions.explanation:
60.

	A century is made up of 100 men therefore a legion had 6000 men.

Saudi Arabia.

	It is located in the western part and is the birthplace of Muhammad.

questions.text: What are snipes, curlews, and frogmouths?
questions.explanation:
Birds.

	The snipe is a shorebird of the sandpiper family. The curlew is the largest member of the sandpiper family and the frogmouth is a wide mouth species of the goatsucker order.
